body_content.explanation: an arrangement between two or more airlines in which one company operates a flight and another company or other companies can sell seats on it, using their own flight number:
examples: Both flights are operated by the Belgian carrier SN Brussels under a codeshare with BA.
Wednesday's flight was a code share with the German carrier Lufthansa.
USAir and United announced a code-share agreement.

body_content.explanation: (of airlines) to make an arrangement in which one company operates a flight and another company or other companies can sell seats on it, using their own flight number:
examples: United Airlines, the US airline, has agreed to codeshare with Ireland's Aer Lingus.
These two airlines codeshare on a number of routes.
The onward codeshared flight is operated by Air France.
